meanings.def: a chemical element. Silver is a shiny, grey-white precious metal used for making coins, jewellery, beautiful objects, etc.
examples: a silver ring/chain
made of solid silver
a silver mine
Silver is extracted from ore.
a gemstone set in silver
a knife with a polished silver casing
There was a streak of silver in her hair.
silver of something the shimmering silver of the moon

meanings.def: dishes, beautiful objects, etc. that are made of silver
examples: Thieves stole £5 000 worth of silver.
They've had to sell the family silver to pay the bills.

meanings.def: coins that are made of silver or a metal that looks like silver
examples: I need £2 in silver for the parking meter.

meanings.def: a medal that is given to the person or the team that wins the second prize in a race or competition
examples: She won silver in last year's championships.
The team won two silvers and a bronze.
Her run was enough to secure silver for the team.
She got a silver in the long jump.
She managed to snatch the silver from the defending champion.

meanings.def: to give somebody money so that they will do you a favour, especially tell your fortune
every sad or difficult situation has a positive side
if you are given something on a silver platter, you do not have to do much to get it
examples: These rich kids expect to have it all handed to them on a silver platter.
